comment:
"With cube
0-1.5: Disgusting. Worth only mixing or meeting the drain. 
2: Bad. Drinkable, but majorly flawed 
2.5: Sub-par. OK, but bland or somewhat flawed. 
3: Good. Decent stuff, but I won’t be rushing to buy it 
3.5: Very good. I’d love to keep a bottle around
4: Excellent. I would like to own a case. A go to for me that is worthy of celebrating 
4.5: Incredible.Truly high end, elite level, very noteworthy
5: Sublime. Nearly perfect and an all time favorite
Smells of cherry. Harsh finish, with a flavor that begs to be paired with sweetness.

Batch 16 Bottle 752 - Medium legs in glass.  Sniffer is shot, totally dead today, I'm afraid.  Front is all honey with a little grass, middle brings out the vanilla and rye bread and cloves.  Finish brings smoke, a little white pepper, and a little oak.  Very short.  Mouth feel is very thin, nothing to chew here.
    
    Not quite sweet enough for my wife, no where near spicy enough for me.  This will end up being a mixer bottle for us.  I have a later batch that I will open and review when this one is done.
Cherries and Mr. Pibb up front. Pretty sweet... but not as sweet as you!
oak notes up front, leathery, very little burn
Woody with chocolate undertones. Pairs well with Covid and Westworld.
Nose: green apple, vanilla, cherries. Taste: Green apples, wood, some spice. Finish: Peppery and sweet. I love this stuff.
Nice for a younger bourbon. Strong vanilla finish.
Not great, not bad - overall strong flavor of cherries and not in a bad way.
